cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest then north, make landfall along Florida’s Big-Bend coast, cross Georgia/South Carolina, and emerge off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Big-Bend, then Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤3%) chance of gale-force winds; generally breezy conditions expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington, DE given distant track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible late Friday into Saturday as the system passes well offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware Bay and Atlantic beaches.
